name: Aconcagua
hint: The highest mountain in South America and the Western Hemisphere, located in the Argentine Andes

name: Ojos del Salado
hint: The highest volcano in the world and second-highest peak in South America, on the Argentina-Chile border

name: Monte Pissis
hint: The third-highest mountain in the Western Hemisphere, an extinct volcano in northwestern Argentina

name: Huascaran
hint: The highest mountain in Peru and the tropics, in the Cordillera Blanca of the Andes

name: Chimborazo
hint: The highest mountain in Ecuador, whose summit is the farthest point from Earth's center due to the equatorial bulge

name: Cotopaxi
hint: One of the highest active volcanoes in the world, a symmetrical cone near Quito, Ecuador

name: Illimani
hint: The highest peak in the Cordillera Real of Bolivia, towering over the city of La Paz

name: Roraima
hint: A flat-topped table mountain (tepui) at the junction of Venezuela, Brazil, and Guyana, inspiration for The Lost World

name: Fitz Roy
hint: An iconic granite peak in Patagonia on the Argentina-Chile border, famous for its dramatic spire shape

name: Alpamayo
hint: A pyramidal peak in Peru's Cordillera Blanca, once voted the most beautiful mountain in the world
